abstracts.cdata!:
The Koudougou Pilot Agricultural Project
            will consist of strengthening and reorganizing the extension
            service according to the training and visit system and
            provision of inputs and equipment. Modifications will be
            made and new elements added, to adopt existing extension
            recommendations to the particular soil and climatic
            conditions of the project area. New recommendations will be
            the use of local rock phosphate with or without urea, the
            introduction of drought-resistant crop varieties, crop
            association methods and fallowing practices, the integration
            of animal husbandry and crop cultivation as well as the
            construction of contour bunds by means of animal traction.
            The project will include an adaptive research component,
            which will conduct the necessary trials. Because the project
            stresses the need for integration of animal husbandry and
            crop cultivation, it will also contain an animal health
            component. A strong monitoring and evaluation unit will
            determine to what extent the techniques will be successful
            by conducting a base line survey at the start of the project
            and follow-up of key technical parameters (particularly
            fertilizer response rates). Special emphasis will be placed
            on the study of farm budgets for various farming systems.
